content:
Snowbombing是一个滑雪胜地的节日，每年春季在奥地利的Mayrhofen滑雪胜地举行。

 

历史
该活动自2000年开始举办，当时它首次在法国的里苏尔度假村举行，是由来自曼彻斯特的英国推广人Outgoing Ltd.发起的滑雪后夜店推广活动。然而，自2005年以来，奥地利的Mayrhofen度假村一直主办该节日，并发展成为欧洲最大的滑雪和音乐节。最初是以DJ和电子舞曲为主题的活动，2008年加入现场表演，反映了独立/摇滚音乐的重新崛起。 该活动的形式旨在将冬季运动（主要是单板滑雪）与滑雪道上和滑雪后的音乐表演以及不寻常地点的主题派对相结合，包括冰屋村、森林空地、传统的偏远高山农庄和露天街头派对。

 

在Snowbombing出现过的艺术家包括Fatboy Slim, Madness, Pendulum, Example, Magnetic Man, Sub Focus, Tinie Tempah, Chase & Status, Skream & Benga, Mark Ronson, Dizzee Rascal, Dirty Pretty Things, Grandmaster Flash, Foals, 2ManyDJs, The Enemy, Zane Lowe, Freestylers, Mylo, Dave Clarke, Gilles Peterson, Fabio, Grooverider, Tim Westwood, The Prodigy, The Vaccines, Skrillex, Pendulum, The Doves, The Cuban Brothers, Ton! c和James Zabiela。

 

该活动还因给参加活动的人提供了一个替代飞行的机会而引人注目。 雪崩公路之旅不是一场比赛，而是从英国到梅尔霍芬的一次悠闲的国际驾驶，包括在途中收集积分，在法兰克福过夜的 "中转站"，以及抵达梅尔霍芬的游行 - 宣布活动开始。

 

大约有50个游泳池和桑拿浴室，身后是令人叹为观止的阿尔卑斯山风景，Snowbombing认为自己是一个节日，除了音乐之外，还提供豪华和舒适。 欧洲的电视频道和广播电台都报道过这个活动，包括BBC Radio 1、Channel 4、Eurosport、Canal+和MTV Europe。
contentEn:
Snowbombing is a ski resort festival, held annually in the spring at the Austrian ski resort of Mayrhofen.

 

History

The event has been run since 2000 when it was first held at the French resort of Risoul as an après-ski nightclub promotional exercise started by English promoters from Manchester called Outgoing Ltd.[1][2] However, since 2005, the Tyrolean resort of Mayrhofen in Austria has hosted the festival which has evolved into Europe's biggest snow and music festival.[1][3] Originally a DJ and electronic dance music-themed event, live acts were added to the bill in 2008, reflecting the resurgence of indie/rock music. The event's format is designed to combine winter sports (primarily snowboarding) with on-piste and après-ski music performances and themed parties in unusual locations, including an igloo village (pictured), a forest clearing, a traditional remote alpine farmstead and an open-air street party.[4][5]

 

Artists who have appeared at Snowbombing include Fatboy Slim, Madness, Pendulum, Example, Magnetic Man, Sub Focus, Tinie Tempah, Chase & Status, Skream & Benga, Mark Ronson, Dizzee Rascal, Dirty Pretty Things, Grandmaster Flash, Foals, 2ManyDJs, The Enemy, Zane Lowe, Freestylers, Mylo, Dave Clarke, Gilles Peterson, Fabio, Grooverider, Tim Westwood, The Prodigy, The Vaccines, Skrillex, Pendulum, The Doves, The Cuban Brothers, Ton!c and James Zabiela.[2][6]

 

The event is also notable for giving those who attend an alternative to flying. The Snowbombing Road Trip is not a race but a leisurely international drive from the UK to Mayrhofen, involving collecting points en route, an overnight 'pit stop' in Frankfurt, and an arrival procession in Mayrhofen – which declares the event open.[7]

 

With around fifty pools and saunas within easy reach, and a backdrop of breathtaking alpine scenery, Snowbombing regards itself as a festival which, in addition to music, additionally offers luxury and comfort.[who?] European television channels and radio broadcasters have covered the event, including BBC Radio 1, Channel 4, Eurosport, Canal+ and MTV Europe.[1]

 

References

  1. ^ Jump up to:a b c Taking music to the mountain, BBC News, 28 November 2005
  2. ^ Jump up to:a b "Snowbombing" by Gemma Freeman Ski and Snowboard Magazine UK, 1 March 2008
  3. ^ Snowbombing festival preview by Simone Baird, Time Out London, 20 March 2008
  4. ^ "Star Quality" by Nick Dalton, Daily Telegraph, 20 October 2007
  5. ^ "Glide into party central in the Austrian Alps" by Paul Rhodes, Daily Express, 1 March 2008
  6. ^ "Muslim cinema, music fests, and snowbombing" by Christopher Muther The Boston Globe, 17 February 2008
  7. ^ http://www.snowbombing.com/en/roadtrip/ The Snowbombing Road Trip
  8. ^ "SNOWBOARDS, BEER, DJS ACTION!" Archived 30 January 2012 at the Wayback Machine by Lucas Magoon Ryan Air Magazine 10 February 2009
  9. ^ "Snowbombing" Archived 21 February 2014 at the Wayback Machine, DJ Vibe 22 January 2003
